15 sys.path.append(rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin'))
16 from scripts import utils # noqa: E402

20 RATE = rospy.get_param('/dynamic_frequency')
21 SIM_DT = 1.0 / RATE
22 OSCILLATION_TIME = rospy.get_param('/oscillation_time')
23 FREQS = rospy.get_param('/oscillation_frequency')
24 AMPLITUDES = rospy.get_param('/oscillation_magnitude')
25 IS_SIM = rospy.get_param('/is_sim')
26 REST_TIME = rospy.get_param('/rest_time')

28 
29 class DynamicPoseData():
30  """
31  Class to store dynamic pose data into a nested dictionary.
32  It is stored as in [20 poses][7 excited joints][7 IMUs][data].
33  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = np.ndarray
34  The data is defined as below.
35  data = [max acceleration, theta at the point].
36  """
37  def __init__(self, pose_names, joint_names, imu_names, filepath):
38  """
39  Initialize DynamicPoseData class.
40 
41  Arguments
42  ----------
43  pose_names: list[str]
44  Names of poses
45  joint_names: list[str]
46  Names of joints
47  imu_names: list[str]
48  Names of imus
49  filepath: str
50  Path to save the collected data
51  """
52  self.pose_names = pose_names
53  self.joint_names = joint_names
54  self.imu_names = imu_names
55 
56  self.filepath = filepath
57  self.data = OrderedDict()
58  self.data_shape = (0, 14)
59 
60  # Create nested dictionary to store data
61  for pose_name in pose_names:
62  self.data[pose_name] = OrderedDict()
63  for joint_name in joint_names:
64  self.data[pose_name][joint_name] = OrderedDict()
65  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
66  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = np.empty(self.data_shape, float)
67 
68  def append(self, pose_name, joint_name, imu_name, data):
69  """
70  Append data to a dictionary whose keys are
71  [pose_name][joint_name][imu_name]
72 
73  Arguments
74  ----------
75  pose_name: str
76  Names of poses
77  joint_name: str
78  Names of joints
79  imu_name: str
80  Names of imus
81  data: np.array
82  Numpy array of size (1,4).
83  Includes an accelerometer measurement and a joint angle.
84  """
85  if not isinstance(data, np.ndarray):
86  raise ValueError('"data" must be a np.ndarray')
87 
88  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = \
89  np.append(self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name], np.array([data]), axis=0)
90  # rospy.loginfo('[{}, {}, {}] {}'.format(pose_name, joint_name, imu_name, data[:3]))
91 
92  def clean_data(self, verbose=False, time_range=(0.04, 0.16),
93  eliminate_outliers=True):
94  """
95  Cleans the data.
96 
97  Arguments
98  ----------
99  `verbose`: `bool`
100  Determines if you want to see plots of the original
101  data vs. the filtered data.
102 
103  `time_range`: `tuple`
104  The time range from which the max acceleration is
105  to be found. For example, (0.04, 0.16) means that
106  the max acceleration value will be searched in between 0.04
107  and 0.16 seconds.
108  """
109  # Create nested dictionary to store data
110  data = copy.deepcopy(self.data)
111  for pose_name in self.pose_names:
112  for joint_name in self.joint_names:
113  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
114  # on each pose, for each joint wiggle, get the
115  # maximum acceleration for each skin unit
116  imu_data = self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name]
117  # filter imu acceleration, angular velocities,
118  # joint accelerations
119  imu_accs = imu_data[:, :3]
120 
121  norms = np.linalg.norm(imu_accs, axis=1)
122  joint_accs = imu_data[:, 11]
123  if eliminate_outliers:
124  # use hampel filter for outlier detection
125  # it actually doesn't affect the end result much.
126  norms = utils.hampel_filter_forloop(norms, 10)[0]
127  joint_accs = utils.hampel_filter_forloop(joint_accs, 10)[0]
128 
129  # filter
130  filtered_norms = utils.low_pass_filter(norms, 100.)
131  filtered_joint_accs = utils.low_pass_filter(joint_accs, 100.)
132 
133  # array of imu data - both filtered and raw
134  imu_filtered_arr = []
135  imu_raw_arr = []
136 
137  # max imu acceleration
138  imu_acc_max = 0
139  # max individual joint acceleration
140  joint_acc_max = 0
141  # idx of the max acceleration.
142  best_idx = 0
143 
144  # go through filtered norms and accelerations
145  for idx, (norm, acc) in enumerate(zip(filtered_norms, filtered_joint_accs)):
146  cur_time = imu_data[idx, 10]
147  # add filtered and raw data to array
148  imu_filtered_arr.append(norm)
149  imu_raw_arr.append(norms[idx])
150  """
151  conditions for update of best idx:
152  - the filtered norm is greater than the current highest one.
153  - the time of this data lies within `time_range`
154  - the filtered joint acceleration is also greater than the current highest one.
155 
156  """
157  if norm > imu_acc_max and cur_time < time_range[1] and cur_time > time_range[0] and acc > joint_acc_max:
158  best_idx = idx
159  imu_acc_max = norm
160  joint_acc_max = acc
161  # update data to the max acceleration point
162  best = self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name][best_idx]
163 
164  self.data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name] = [best]
165 
166  if verbose:
167  # plots the acceleration norms - filtered and raw
168  plt.plot(imu_raw_arr)
169  plt.plot(imu_filtered_arr)
170  plt.show()
171 
172  rospy.loginfo(data[pose_name][joint_name][imu_name])
173 
174  return data
175 
176  def save(self, data):
177  """
178  Saves the data to a pickle file.
179 
180  Arguments
181  ----------
182  `data`: `OrderedDict`
183  The data to be saved
184  """
185  ros_robotic_skin_path = rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin')
186  filepath = os.path.join(ros_robotic_skin_path, self.filepath+'.pickle')
187 
188  with open(filepath, 'wb') as f:
189  pickle.dump(data, f)
190 
191 
192 class DynamicPoseDataSaver():
193  """
194  Class for collecting dynamic pose data and save them as a pickle file
195  """
196  def __init__(self, controller, poses_list, filepath='data/dynamic_data', is_sim=True):
197  """
198  Initializes DynamicPoseDataSaver class.
199 
200  Arguments
201  -----------
202  controller:
203  Wrapped controller to control either Panda or Sawyer robot.
204  poses_list: list
205  A list of poses. Each pose is a list.
206  It includes 7 joint position, 7 joint velociites, and Pose name
207  filepath: str
208  File path to save the collected data
209  """
210  self.controller = controller
211  self.poses_list = poses_list
212  self.is_sim = is_sim
213  # constant
214  self.pose_names = [pose[2] for pose in poses_list]
215  self.joint_names = map(str, self.controller.joint_names)
216 
217  # get imu names and topics through rostopic and xacro.
218  self.imu_names, self.imu_topics = utils.get_imu_names_and_topics()
219 
220  self.curr_pose_name = self.pose_names[0]
221  self.curr_joint_name = self.joint_names[0]
222  self.prev_angular_velocity = 0.0
223 
224  self.watch_dt = StopWatch()
225  self.watch_motion = StopWatch()
226 
227  self.r = rospy.Rate(RATE)
228 
229  # data storage
230  self.data_storage = DynamicPoseData(self.pose_names, self.joint_names, self.imu_names, filepath)
231  # Subscribe to IMUs
232  for imu_topic in self.imu_topics:
233  rospy.Subscriber(imu_topic, Imu, self.callback)
234 
235  def callback(self, data):
236  """
237  A callback function for IMU topics
238 
239  Arguments
240  ----------
241  data: sensor_msgs.msg.Imu
242  IMU data. Please refer to the official documentation.
243  http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html
244  """
245  if self.watch_motion.is_started():
246  acceleration = utils.Vector3_to_np(data.linear_acceleration)
247 
248  dt = self.watch_dt.get_elapsed_time()
249  self.watch_dt.restart()
250  if self.is_sim and dt <= 0.9*SIM_DT:
251  return
252 
253  curr_angular_velocity = self.controller.joint_velocity(self.curr_joint_name)
254  angular_acceleration = (curr_angular_velocity - self.prev_angular_velocity) / dt
255  self.prev_angular_velocity = curr_angular_velocity
256 
257  joint_angles = self.controller.joint_angles
258 
259  # time
260  t = self.watch_motion.get_elapsed_time()
261  self.data_storage.append(
262  pose_name=self.curr_pose_name, # for each defined initial pose
263  joint_name=self.curr_joint_name, # for each excited joint
264  imu_name=data.header.frame_id, # for each imu
265  data=np.r_[
266  acceleration,
267  joint_angles,
268  t,
269  angular_acceleration,
270  AMPLITUDES[0],
271  curr_angular_velocity,
272  ]
273  )
274 
275  def goto_current_pose(self, pose):
276  positions, _, pose_name = pose[0], pose[1], pose[2] # noqa: F841
277  self.curr_pose_name = pose_name
278  # first, move to the position from <robot>_positions.txt
279  self.controller.publish_positions(positions, sleep=REST_TIME)
280  print('At Position: ' + pose_name,
281  map(int, np.rad2deg * np.array(positions)))
282 
283  def prepare_recording(self, joint_name):
284  # Set current joint
285  self.curr_joint_name = joint_name
286  # Set current joint velocity
287  self.prev_angular_velocity = self.controller.joint_velocity(self.curr_joint_name)
288  # Start Stop Watchs
289  self.watch_dt.start()
290 
291  def move_like_sine_dynamic(self):
292  """
293  This will move the joint of the robot arm like a sine wave
294  for all joints for all defined poses.
295  """
296  self.controller.set_joint_position_speed(speed=1.0)
297 
298  for pose in self.poses_list:
299  for i, joint_name in enumerate(self.joint_names):
300  # Go to current setting position
301  self.goto_current_pose(pose)
302  print("At the pose.")
303  # Initialize Variables
304  self.prepare_recording(joint_name)
305  # Prepare for publishing velocities
306  velocities = np.zeros(len(self.joint_names))
307 
308  # Start motion and recording
309  self.watch_motion.start()
310  while True:
311  # time within motion
312  t = self.watch_motion.get_elapsed_time()
313 
314  # Oscillated Velocity pattern
315  velocities[i] = AMPLITUDES[i] * np.sin(2 * pi * FREQS[i] * t)
316  self.controller.send_velocities(velocities)
317 
318  if t > OSCILLATION_TIME:
319  break
320 
321  if rospy.is_shutdown():
322  return
323 
324  self.r.sleep()
325  self.watch_motion.stop()
326  rospy.sleep(1)
327 
328  def save(self, save=True, verbose=False, clean=False):
329  """
330  Save data to a pickle file.
331 
332 
333  Arguments
334  ----------
335  `save`: `bool`
336  If the data will be saved
337 
338  `verbose`: `bool`
339  """
340  if clean:
341  data = self.data_storage.clean_data(verbose)
342  else:
343  data = self.data_storage.data
344 
345  if save:
346  rospy.loginfo('saving')
347  self.data_storage.save(data)
348 
349 
350 if __name__ == "__main__":
351  # [Pose, Joint, IMU, x, y, z]* number os samples according to hertz
352  robot = sys.argv[1]
353 
354  rospy.init_node('dynamic_pose_saver')
355 
356  if robot == 'panda':
357  controller = PandaController(is_sim=IS_SIM)
358  filename = 'panda_positions.txt'
359  elif robot == 'sawyer':
360  controller = SawyerController()
361  filename = 'sawyer_positions.txt'
362  else:
363  raise ValueError("Must be either panda or sawyer")
364 
365  if len(sys.argv) > 2:
366  filename = sys.argv[2]
367 
368  poses_list = utils.get_poses_list_file(filename)
369  filepath = '_'.join(['data/dynamic_data', robot])
370 
371  dd = DynamicPoseDataSaver(controller, poses_list, filepath, IS_SIM)
372  dd.move_like_sine_dynamic()
373  dd.save(save=True, verbose=False, clean=False)
